visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Data labels with contrast', Axes and labels styling: Define colors, font sizes, or styles for labels, axes, and titles, Data series: Provide the data for each series, including the name of each series and its data, formatted appropriately for Highcharts, Custom colors: Specific list of colors, if desired, Additional configurations: Other settings, such as chart margins, background, legend, etc.

subtitle.text: Adjust data label color and shadow to underlying column

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with specific styling and data series. The chart type is set to 'column', and the title is 'Data labels with contrast'. The x-axis and y-axis labels are styled with a color of #333 and a font size of 12px, while the y-axis title is styled with a color of #333 and a font size of 14px. The data series includes monthly data points from January to December, with data labels enabled and styled to contrast with the underlying columns. The chart uses a specific list of colors for the columns and disables the legend for a cleaner look. Additional configurations include enabling data labels for the columns and setting the chart to styled mode for CSS integration.
